alert.note: Alert for Jasper; Mahaska; Marion; Marshall; Polk; Poweshiek; Story; Tama; Warren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 13 at 1:11AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms with gusty winds will impact portions of Poweshiek, eastern Polk, eastern Story, Marshall, Marion, western Tama, Mahaska, Jasper and eastern Warren Counties through 215 AM CDT... At 109 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles south of Iowa Falls to 8 miles northeast of Nevada to near Mitchellville to 10 miles southeast of Indianola. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph with a few gust above 50 mph probable. The Des Moines International Airport gusted to 53 mph at 1246 AM and a personal weather station in Sheldahl gusted to 53 mph as well at 1241 AM. Ames Airport gusted to 46 mph at 1241 AM. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Colfax and Prairie City around 115 AM CDT. State Center around 120 AM CDT. Newton and Melcher-Dallas around 125 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Knoxville, Marshalltown, Rock Creek Lake and Grinnell. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 147 and 195. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Jasper; Mahaska; Marion; Marshall; Polk; Poweshiek; Story; Tama; Warren
